iterations.yara_rule:
rule Bypass_Sample
{
    meta:
        description = "Evasion bypass rule"
        cape_options = "bp0=$pattern0+0,action0=skip,bp1=$pattern1+0,action1=skip,bp2=$pattern2+0,action2=skip,count=0"

    strings:
        $pattern0 = { 8B FF 55 8B EC FF 75 08 E8 C8 FF FF FF } // Skipping call to 0040E7C3h (TRACE //1) - 13 bytes
        $pattern1 = { 8B FF 55 8B EC FF 75 08 FF 15 AC B0 41 00 } // Skipping call to [0041B0ACh] (TRACE //2) - 12 bytes
        $pattern2 = { FF 75 08 E8 C8 FF FF FF 59 FF 75 08 } // Manipulating the push dword ptr [ebp+08h] - 11 bytes

    condition:
        any of them
}
iterations.failure_reason: Rule hit but no new signatures
improvement_suggestions: Remove the `cape_options` entirely. The intent seems to be to extract signatures from different parts of the code sequence, but the `skip` actions are not achieving this correctly. Instead, create separate YARA rules targeting each instruction sequence individually. This will allow for more precise signature creation and avoid the erroneous attempts to modify execution flow.

```yara
rule Bypass_Sample
{
    meta:
        description = "Evasion bypass rule"
        cape_options = "bp0=$pattern0+0,action0=skip,bp1=$pattern1+0,action1=skip,bp2=$pattern2+0,action2=skip,count=0"

    strings:
        $pattern0 = { 8BFF 55 8BEC FF7508 E8C8FFFFFF } // Skipping call to 0040E7C3h (TRACE #1) - 13 bytes
        $pattern1 = { 8BFF 55 8BEC FF7508 FF15ACB04100 } // Skipping call to [0041B0ACh] (TRACE #2) - 12 bytes
        $pattern2 = { FF7508 E8C8FFFFFF 59 FF7508 } // Manipulating the push dword ptr [ebp+08h] - 11 bytes

    condition:
        any of them
}
```
